draw something ↔ down.translation[0].def: to obtain money that it has been agreed that you can borrow, or to use money that has been saved
He drew down the final $25 million of the loan.
draw something ↔ down.translation[1].def: to obtain money as part of a loan that has already been agreed, or to use money that has been saved
He drew down the final $25 million of the Bankers Trust loan.
A lot of Japanese people will soon reach retirement and begin to draw down their life savings.
to use something that has been reserved or stored
Consuming nations should draw down their high oil inventories before asking OPEC to produce more.
